title: How to Get Picture in Picture on YouTube: Guide + Troubleshooting

steps.title: Enable picture-in-picture on your Android.
steps.content: Enable picture-in-picture on your Android. Before you can use picture-in-picture (PiP) on YouTube, you must have it enabled in your phone or tablet's settings. Do the following: Open Settings . Tap Apps & notifications . Tap Advanced . Tap Special app access . Tap Picture-in-picture . Tap YouTube . Tap Allow picture-in-picture .

steps.title: Open your YouTube app settings.
steps.content: Open your YouTube app settings. In the YouTube app on your Android, tap your profile picture, and then tap the cog icon. You can use picture-in-picture for most content on YouTube. However, if you don't have a YouTube Premium membership, you won't be able to watch certain content, such as music videos. If you live outside of the United States, you must have a Premium membership to use picture-in-picture with any content on YouTube.

steps.title: Tap Playback.
steps.content: Tap Playback . This will be underneath the Video and audio preferences header.

steps.title: Toggle on "Picture-in-picture".
steps.content: Toggle on "Picture-in-picture". This is the last option. The switch should turn blue (on). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Play a video.
steps.content: Play a video. You can browse your home page or use the search bar to find a specific video. Once you find one, tap the play button to start it.

steps.title: Minimize the app.
steps.content: Minimize the app. On Android, you can swipe up from the bottom to go to your home screen. You can also switch to a different app, but you'll need to make sure the new app has no active audio. Otherwise, it can pause or disrupt your YouTube video. To exit out of PiP, return to the app. You can also tap the video and then the X . If picture-in-picture on YouTube doesn't work, you may not have YouTube Premium, which allows all types of content in PiP. See our troubleshooting section for more fixes.

steps.title: Enable picture-in-picture on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Enable picture-in-picture on your iPhone or iPad. Before you can use picture-in-picture (PiP) on YouTube, you must have it enabled in your phone or tablet's settings. Do the following: Open the Settings app. Tap General . Tap Picture in picture . Toggle on Start PiP Automatically .

steps.title: Open your YouTube app settings.
steps.content: Open your YouTube app settings. You can find your settings in the YouTube app by tapping your profile picture, and then tapping the cog icon. You can use picture-in-picture for most content on YouTube. However, if you don't have a YouTube Premium membership, you won't be able to watch certain content, such as music videos. If you live outside of the United States, you must have a Premium membership to use picture-in-picture with any content on YouTube.

steps.title: Tap Playback.
steps.content: Tap Playback . This will be underneath the Video and audio preferences header.

steps.title: Toggle on "Picture-in-picture".
steps.content: Toggle on "Picture-in-picture". This is the last option. The switch should turn blue (on).

steps.title: Play a video.
steps.content: Play a video. You can browse your home page or use the search bar to find a specific video. Once you find one, tap the play button to start it.

steps.title: Minimize the YouTube app.
steps.content: Minimize the YouTube app. On iPhone and iPad, you can swipe up from the bottom to go to your home screen, or press the home button. You can also switch to a different app, but you'll need to make sure the new app has no active audio. Otherwise, it can pause or disrupt your YouTube video. To exit out of PiP, return to the app. You can also tap the video, and then tap the X . If picture-in-picture doesn't work, you may not have YouTube Premium, which allows all types of content in PiP. See our troubleshooting section for more fixes.

steps.title: Open a YouTube Video on your PC, Mac, or Chromebook.
steps.content: Open a YouTube Video on your PC, Mac, or Chromebook. If you're using YouTube in a desktop web browser, you can see the video in a floating window that can be moved around your desktop and other open applications. You can browse your home page or use the search bar to find a specific video.

steps.title: Hover over the video and click the Picture-in-Picture (Miniplayer) icon.
steps.content: Hover over the video and click the Picture-in-Picture (Miniplayer) icon. This looks like an arrow inside of a square pointing to a smaller square. It will be inside of the video. Once you do this, you'll return to your YouTube homepage, but you'll have a small picture-in-picture window on top. When you hover your cursor over the correct icon, you will see "Miniplayer" near your cursor.

steps.title: Move the miniplayer window.
steps.content: Move the miniplayer window. If you want to move the video in PiP mode, click and drag the video to the desired location. To resize the video, click and drag a corner of the video inwards to make it smaller or outwards to make it bigger. To exit out of Picture-in-Picture mode, click the X in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Try a different video.
steps.content: Try a different video. If Picture-in-Picture isn't working in the YouTube app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad, you may be trying to watch a video that isn't supported for free YouTube accounts. Try a different video (such as a personal vlog) to see if the problem still occurs.

steps.title: Subscribe to YouTube Premium.
steps.content: Subscribe to YouTube Premium. If you live outside the US or want to be able to use Picture in Picture on YouTube for all videos, subscribe to YouTube Premium . [2] X Research source This membership allows you to watch any YouTube video in Picture-in-Picture mode. If you live outside of the US, you must have a YouTube Premium membership to watch any video on YouTube in Picture-in-Picture mode.

steps.title: Restart your device.
steps.content: Restart your device. If you changed your device's settings, you may need to fully restart it to apply those changes so picture in picture will work.

steps.title: Reinstall the YouTube app.
steps.content: Reinstall the YouTube app. If the issue is with the YouTube app, you can uninstall it completely on some devices, and then download it again from your app store. This also clears the app cache for the YouTube app on iOS devices.
